Package space.sunqian.common.io

Class BufferKit

java.lang.Object
space.sunqian.common.io.BufferKit
public class BufferKit extends Object
Utilities for Buffer related.

  • Method Details

    • arrayStartIndex

      public static int arrayStartIndex(@Nonnull @Nonnull Buffer buffer) throws ReadOnlyBufferException, UnsupportedOperationException
      Returns the actual start index (inclusive) of the backing array in the given buffer.
      Parameters:
      buffer - the given buffer
      Returns:
      the actual start index (inclusive) of the backing array in the given buffer
      Throws:
      ReadOnlyBufferException - if the buffer is backed by an array but is read-only
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the buffer is not backed by an accessible array

    • arrayEndIndex

      public static int arrayEndIndex(@Nonnull @Nonnull Buffer buffer) throws ReadOnlyBufferException, UnsupportedOperationException
      Returns the actual start index (exclusive) of the backing array in the given buffer.
      Parameters:
      buffer - the given buffer
      Returns:
      the actual start index (exclusive) of the backing array in the given buffer
      Throws:
      ReadOnlyBufferException - if the buffer is backed by an array but is read-only
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the buffer is not backed by an accessible array

    • read

      public static byte @Nullable [] read(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src)
      Reads all data from the source buffer into a new array, continuing until reaches the end of the source buffer, and returns the array.

      If reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns null.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read

    • read

      public static byte @Nullable [] read(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Reads a specified length of data from the source buffer into a new array, and returns the array. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty array without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the source buffer.

      If reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns null.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a new array containing the read data, or null if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal

    • readTo

      public static int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, byte @Nonnull [] dst)
      Reads data from the source buffer into the destination array, until the read number reaches the array's length or reaches the end of the source buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the array's length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      dst - the destination array
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read

    • readTo

      public static int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, byte @Nonnull [] dst, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Reads a specified length of data from the source buffer into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the source buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      dst - the destination array
      off - the specified offset of the array
      len - the specified length to read
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds

    • readTo

      public static int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the source buffer into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of any buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns -1.

      The both buffers' positions increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      public static int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from the source buffer into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of any buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns -1.

      The both buffers' positions increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      public static int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, @Nonnull @Nonnull WritableByteChannel dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from the source buffer into the destination channel, until reaches the end of the source buffer, and returns the actual number of bytes read to.

      If reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      dst - the destination channel
      Returns:
      the actual number of bytes read to, or -1 if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      Reads data from the source buffer into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of any buffer, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns -1.

      The both buffers' positions increments by the actual read number.

    • string

      @Nullable public static @Nullable String string(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer src)
      Reads all data from the source buffer as a string, continuing until reaches the end of the source buffer, and returns the string.

      If reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns null.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      Returns:
      a string represents the read data, or null if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read

    • string

      @Nullable public static @Nullable String string(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Reads a specified length of data from the source buffer as a string, and returns the string. If the specified length is 0, returns an empty string without reading. Otherwise, this method keeps reading until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the source buffer.

      If reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns null.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      len - the specified read length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      a string represents the read data, or null if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal

    • string

      @Nullable public static @Nullable String string(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src)
      Reads all data from the source buffer as a string with CharsKit.defaultCharset(), continuing until reaches the end of the source buffer, and returns the string.

      If reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns null.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      Returns:
      a string represents the read data, with CharsKit.defaultCharset(), or null if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read

    • string

      @Nullable public static @Nullable String string(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, @Nonnull @Nonnull Charset cs)
      Reads all data from the source buffer as a string with the specified charset, continuing until reaches the end of the source buffer, and returns the string.

      If reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read, returns null.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      src - the source buffer
      cs - the specified charset
      Returns:
      a string represents the read data, with the specified charset, or null if reaches the end of the source buffer and no data is read

      Writes string to the specified buffer with CharsKit.defaultCharset().
      Parameters:
      dst - the specified buffer
      str - the string to write to the buffer
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

      Parameters:
      dst - the specified buffer
      str - the string to write to the buffer

      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • slice

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull ByteBuffer slice(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new buffer with the specified length. Its content is a shared subsequence of the given buffer's content, starting at the given buffer's current position.

      Changes to the given buffer's content will be visible in the new buffer, and vice versa. The new buffer's position will be zero, its capacity and limit will be the specified length. The new buffer will be direct if, and only if, the given buffer is direct, and it will be read-only if, and only if, the given buffer is read-only.

      The position and limit of the given buffer will not be changed.

      Parameters:
      src - the given buffer
      len - the specified length
      Returns:
      a new buffer whose content is a shared subsequence of the given buffer's content
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal

    • slice

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull ByteBuffer slice(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Creates a new buffer with the specified length. Its content is a shared subsequence of the given buffer's content, starting at the specified offset of given buffer's current position (src.position() + off).

      Changes to the given buffer's content will be visible in the new buffer, and vice versa. The new buffer's position will be zero, its capacity and limit will be the specified length. The new buffer will be direct if, and only if, the given buffer is direct, and it will be read-only if, and only if, the given buffer is read-only.

      The position and limit of the given buffer will not be changed.

      Parameters:
      src - the given buffer
      off - the specified offset
      len - the specified length
      Returns:
      a new buffer whose content is a shared subsequence of the given buffer's content
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset and length is out of bounds

    • slice

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull CharBuffer slice(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer src, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new buffer with the specified length. Its content is a shared subsequence of the given buffer's content, starting at the given buffer's current position.

      Changes to the given buffer's content will be visible in the new buffer, and vice versa. The new buffer's position will be zero, its capacity and limit will be the specified length. The new buffer will be direct if, and only if, the given buffer is direct, and it will be read-only if, and only if, the given buffer is read-only.

      The position and limit of the given buffer will not be changed.

      Parameters:
      src - the given buffer
      len - the specified length
      Returns:
      a new buffer whose content is a shared subsequence of the given buffer's content
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal

    • slice

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull CharBuffer slice(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer src, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Creates a new buffer with the specified length. Its content is a shared subsequence of the given buffer's content, starting at the specified offset of given buffer's current position (src.position() + off).

      Changes to the given buffer's content will be visible in the new buffer, and vice versa. The new buffer's position will be zero, its capacity and limit will be the specified length. The new buffer will be direct if, and only if, the given buffer is direct, and it will be read-only if, and only if, the given buffer is read-only.

      The position and limit of the given buffer will not be changed.

      Parameters:
      src - the given buffer
      off - the specified offset
      len - the specified length
      Returns:
      a new buffer whose content is a shared subsequence of the given buffer's content
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the offset and length is out of bounds

    • copy

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull ByteBuffer copy(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src)
      Returns a new buffer copied from the given source buffer. The content of the new buffer is independent and copied from 0 to src.capacity() (not src.position() to src.limit()).

      Position of the source buffer will not be changed. The new buffer's position, limit and capacity are same with the source buffer's, and the new buffer is direct if, and only if, the source buffer is direct.

      Parameters:
      src - the given source buffer
      Returns:
      a new buffer copied from the given source buffer

    • copy

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull CharBuffer copy(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer src)
      Returns a new buffer copied from the given source buffer. The content of the new buffer is independent and copied from 0 to src.capacity() (not src.position() to src.limit()).

      Position of the source buffer will not be changed. The new buffer's position, limit and capacity are same with the source buffer's, and the new buffer is direct if, and only if, the source buffer is direct.

      Parameters:
      src - the given source buffer
      Returns:
      a new buffer copied from the given source buffer

    • copyContent

      public static byte @Nonnull [] copyContent(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src)
      Returns a new array copied from the remaining content of the given source buffer. Position of the source buffer will not be changed.
      Parameters:
      src - the given source buffer
      Returns:
      a new array copied from the remaining content of the given source buffer

    • copyContent

      public static char @Nonnull [] copyContent(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer src)
      Returns a new array copied from the remaining content of the given source buffer. Position of the source buffer will not be changed.
      Parameters:
      src - the given source buffer
      Returns:
      a new array copied from the remaining content of the given source buffer

    • copyDirect

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull ByteBuffer copyDirect(byte @Nonnull [] src)
      Returns a new direct buffer of which content is copied from the given array.

      Returned buffer's position is 0, limit and capacity is the array's length.

      Parameters:
      src - the given array
      Returns:
      a new direct buffer of which content is copied from the given array

    • copyDirect

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull ByteBuffer copyDirect(byte @Nonnull [] src, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns a new direct buffer of which content is a copy of data from the given array. The copied data starts at the specified offset and has the specified length.

      Returned buffer's position is 0, limit and capacity is the specified length.

      Parameters:
      src - the given array
      off - the specified offset
      len - the specified length
      Returns:
      a new direct buffer of which content is a copy of data from the given array
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • copyDirect

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull CharBuffer copyDirect(char @Nonnull [] src)
      Returns a new direct buffer of which content is copied from the given array.

      Returned buffer's position is 0, limit and capacity is the array's length.

      Parameters:
      src - the given array
      Returns:
      a new direct buffer of which content is copied from the given array

    • copyDirect

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull CharBuffer copyDirect(char @Nonnull [] src, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns a new direct buffer of which content is a copy of data from the given array. The copied data starts at the specified offset and has the specified length.

      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • directCharBuffer

      @Nonnull public static @Nonnull CharBuffer directCharBuffer(int capacity) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a new direct CharBuffer with the specified capacity, and its endian is ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN.

      Returned buffer's position is 0, limit equals to the capacity.

      Parameters:
      capacity - the specified capacity
      Returns:
      a new direct CharBuffer with the specified capacity
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified capacity is negative

    • process

      public static int process(@Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer src, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteBuffer dst, @Nonnull @Nonnull ByteArrayOperator operator) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from the source buffer and processes them by the given operator, then writes the result into the destination buffer, returns the number of bytes written. The position of the source buffer will be increment to its limit, and position of the destination buffer will be increment by the write number.

      Note:

      • Make sure the destination has enough space to write;
      • If an exception occurs during processing, the status of two buffers are undefined;
      Parameters:
      src - the given source buffer
      dst - the given destination buffer
      operator - the given operator
      Returns:
      the number of bytes written
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • process

      public static int process(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer src, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst, @Nonnull @Nonnull CharArrayOperator operator) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from the source buffer and processes them by the given operator, then writes the result into the destination buffer, returns the number of chars written. The position of the source buffer will be increment to its limit, and position of the destination buffer will be increment by the write number.

      Note:

      • Make sure the destination has enough space to write;
      • If an exception occurs during processing, the status of two buffers are undefined;
      Parameters:
      src - the given source buffer
      dst - the given destination buffer
      operator - the given operator
      Returns:
      the number of chars written
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs
